name: Seated Cable Mid Trap Shrug
how_to_perform:
#1. Sit on the edge of a bench or chair, with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
#2. Position yourself in front of a seated cable machine, with the cables at shoulder height and level with your armpits.
#3. Grasp the handles firmly, with your palms facing towards your body.
#4. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring good posture throughout the exercise.
#5. Slowly lift the cables up to mid-trap height by squeezing your traps, keeping your elbows close to your body and avoiding any tilting of your torso.
#6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
#7. Slowly return the cables to the starting position, maintaining good posture throughout the exercise.
#8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The Seated Cable Mid Trap Shrug is a strength training exercise that targets the middle trapezius muscle.
